JavaScript Tutorial ​

Welcome to the comprehensive JavaScript tutorial! This guide will take you from beginner to advanced level.

What is JavaScript? ​

JavaScript is a versatile, high-level programming language primarily used for web development. It enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications.

js
console.log("Hello, JavaScript!");

Tutorial Structure ​

Beginner Level ​

  • Basics - Variables, Data Types, and Operators
  • Control Flow - Conditionals and Loops
  • Functions - Functions and Scope

Intermediate Level ​

  • Arrays - Arrays and Array Methods
  • Objects - Objects and Object Methods
  • DOM Manipulation - Working with the Document Object Model

Advanced Level ​

  • Async Programming - Promises, Async/Await
  • ES6+ Features - Modern JavaScript Features
  • OOP - Object-Oriented Programming
  • Advanced Patterns - Design Patterns and Best Practices

Prerequisites ​

  • Basic understanding of HTML and CSS
  • A code editor (VS Code recommended)
  • A web browser with developer tools

Getting Started ​

You can run JavaScript in several ways:

1. Browser Console ​

Open your browser's developer tools (F12) and use the Console tab.

2. HTML File ​

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>JavaScript Demo</title>
</head>
<body>
    <script>
        console.log("Hello from HTML!");
    </script>
</body>
</html>

3. Node.js ​

bash
node script.js

Let's begin your JavaScript journey!
